messages: 386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:07): with an editable combo box, if you press enter it adds the item.. I want to handle that my self (because I want to do some LRU on the list).. I see that you can set InsertPolicy to NoInsert.. but if I want to then do it myself, am I going to have to install an event filter and then detect when return/enter is pressed?
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:07): or is there something simpler
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:09): duvnell_: Isn't there a signal?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:09): Hmm, there isn't...
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:10): keyPressEvent, then!
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:10): Or an event filter, if you don't want to subclass.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:10): there's editTextChanged .. but it sounds like it's whenever it changes.. but return wouldn't be part of that change
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:10): that what I was trying to avoid
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:10): Hey, it would make sense to encapsulate all of the LRU code in a single class.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:10): It's only logical.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:11): thought I could do it from a slot in the class that 's the parent of the qcombobox widget
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:11): Well...
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:11): dislike creating another class just for this
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:11): Try connecting something to activated() and see what happens
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:12): I think index might be -1 if the "activated" item is a text entry
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:12): ok, I'll hook up to those and see what the behavior is.. (docs are lacking there)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:12): Indeed.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:12): they need to have user-commentable docs like most other sites now
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:13): would reduce their support costs I bet
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:13): I would want to see notes PER class member too not just blob for whole class
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:13): I've heard murmurings that it had been discussed and rejected.
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:19): AFAIK it hasn't been seriously discussed
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:19): Okay, like I said, just murmurings. I didn't want to imply that I was sure about it.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:20): it'd be great if people could put those picky details that are often left out
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:20): I'd sure contribute
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:20): The problem as I see it is that moderation would be a real timesink.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:20): the concept is at least proved
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:20): duvnell: Anything like that you see you can report to <email/> as a bug int he documentation
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:20): wonder how sites like php.net handle that
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:21): well it's just incomplete .. not necessarily wrong
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:21): or code snippets are always nice that people leave
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:21): Incompleteness is a bug IMNSHO
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:21): I'm not sure about the code snippets. I've seen them on php.net with errors and later posts correcting them
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:21): I can just send an email: "please add 'blah blah vlah' to http://url#widget_member name" or something like htaT?
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:22): sure, but it's all understood that some user put it there and is subject to being incorrect.. adding the code and then testing it is alway sa must
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:23): duvnell_: Yes

386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:23): perhaps the moderation could also be user-based.. if there is something completely wrong or something inappropriate you put a little button, and after 5 or 10 clicks someone gets an email so it can be reviewed by someone
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:23): but reducing the "timesink"ness of it
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:23): duvnell_: I'm not sure that our doc team would agree that potentially-wrong code is better than no example at all.
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:23): Or that I do for that matter
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:24): well decent developers will look at the code before committing to it
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:24): i've really never seen it get all that bad
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:24): Those, of course, being the people who are least likely to just lift the code directly
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (23:24): And in least need of it
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:25): a developer can be diligent (in being careful) and still willing to cut and paste or look for other people's solutions
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:25): just saying that it's not 1:1
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:28): Wintre, do you actually work at the Oslo office?
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:29): I have a friend coming that way
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:29): do they offer tours?

481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:29): Hrmph.. I'm trying to resize a dialog to it's contents. Namely, the outermost QVBoxLayout. (I'll later have it resize to it's contents)  What signal could I connect to to tell me when QVBoxLayout is resized?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:29): Mookie: this->setLayout(layout);
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:29): Mookie: Or just set the QVBoxLayout's parent to the dialog
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:29): Mookie, I wish there were a signal that was fired when it was doing laying out
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:29): duvnell_: There's a polish() function that gets called
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:30): does that mean it's done?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:30): !rtfm qwidget
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (23:30): ahigerd: QWidget (Qt 4.1) http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qwidget.html
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:31): Oh wait
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:31): polish() is Qt3
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:31): In Qt4 it's an event

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:31): Mookie: Anyway, if you're trying to MAKE something resize according to its contents, you're doing something wrong with the layout, because that's automatically handled by the system.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:31): ahigerd: Hrm... ok.. I set the parent, but the dialog still comes out too small.  I'll keep reading.
386c4292c62749e6cfd277533e9384c0 (23:31): it mentions ctors being done.. but is it also laid-out at that point?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:32): Mookie: What do you mean it comes out too small?
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:32): ahigerd: Hrm... it's a QVBoxLayout with a QTableWidget and buttons inside.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:32): Mookie: Did you add those widgets to the layout?
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:32): At runtime, the dialog is not expanding to fit the contends.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:33): Show me your code. I've never seen this before.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:33): ackk it's bad at the moment.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:33): Just your widget-layout code.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:33): I don't need anything else.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:34): Let me get on pastebin
d5e40bdb685c2188090e8d1037cc1325 (23:34): sounds like the widgets aren't in the layout
d5e40bdb685c2188090e8d1037cc1325 (23:34): or something
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (23:35): 'Mookie' pasted "Mookie's layout problems": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/542
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:35): I warn you. I'm really just starting here.  :)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:36): Mookie: That's what I was saying.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:36): I need to name the layout as the parent for each widget.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:36): No
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:36): You don't need to do that
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:36): In fact, you can't, because QLayout isn't a QWidget

f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:36): Hm, my chat client can read what the server sends but not contrary. The client connects with connectToHost() and the server uses nextPendingConnection(). Some obvious thing that I've missed?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:37): You use the dialog as the parent widget
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:37): For everything.. or just the outer QVBoxLayout?
f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:42): Hm, maybe the QTcpSocket isn't ReadWrite as default when using nextPendingConnection?
f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:42): Am I wrong?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:43): Mookie: Everything.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:44): Paprika: I think it is ReadWrite.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:44): Mookie: Though assigning them to the layouts reparents them so it shouldn't make a difference. That code looks like it ought to work to me.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:45): Mookie: Now, as a note: QTableWidget doesn't resize itself to ITS contents, if THAT'S the problem.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:45): That's what I'm thinking.  Yes.
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:45): So no trigger gets sent up the chain.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:45): You can just call resize() on your dialog.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:45): In the constructor, for instance.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:46): Or, better yet
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:46): table->setMinimumSizeHint()
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:46): And give it appropriate values
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:46): That way you can't resize your window too small
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:46): I won't mind if the user does it manually, I'm just wanting it to choose sensible defaults when showing.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:47): Fair enough.
f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:47): http://pastebin.com/737662
f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:47): I don't get it.
f1e22cdb372c8735f64625bed0fa6a61 (23:48): I think it should work. :/
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (23:49): See if I can't isolate the QTableWidget as the culprit.
e863baa1a05dc33ae421a3b4efa0ce5f (23:53): hi there
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:55): Lo
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (00:14): Yay! I got ResQPac to work with Qt 4.1.3 in linux :D must have been some 4.0.0 bug with QPainter...
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (00:28): Yep
481f860096d5bcf80027a146db661920 (00:41): Is there good documentation on how sizing works between widgets and layouts? I think I need to review the rules a bit.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (00:42): Mookie: There's really not much documentation, but look in particular at setStretchFactor, the stretch parameter in addWidget, and at sizeHint.

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (00:43): Mookie: In short: "Give a widget no less than its minimum size hint. Give a widget no more than its maximum size hint, if it has one. Distribute remaining space according to stretch factors."
